answers.answer: In one book I read it said it is not safe for the baby to remain in the womb past 42 weeks so women were induced for that reason
Usually health reasons for either you or the baby.

Most of the reasons are problematic. low fluid, lack of growth, preeclampsia...might not be too serious but its due to something that isn't something you would want. Also being past your due date. Doctors are different, but most wont induce simply because youre miserable. Some may within a week of the due date for an important family issue...such as your husband being deployed. It is unethical to induce before 39 weeks if not for medical purposes.

I'm been induced at 38+2 due to hip displacement I am struggling to walk climb stairs stand sit everything even laying down is a hard task for me and I have a 3 and a half year old that is more active then anyone I have ever seen
I had to be induced at 38 weeks because I had gestational diabeties and my doctor didn't want to risk my son getting to big for a vaginal delivery. ( He weighed 8lbs and I'm 5ft lol)
I had to be induced at 38 weeks because I had gestational diabeties and my doctor didn't want to risk my son getting to big for a vaginal delivery. ( He weighed 8lbs, 20in. and I'm 5ft lol)
You can have an elective induction at or after 39 weeks. People have different opinions on that of course but if your doctor agrees, it's totally up to you.

question: What are reasons drs induce people?
title: induction..
